section.audio_text: Manual stabilizer trim should be used as needed to keep the airplane in-trim. A two-pilot effort may be used to correct an out of trim condition and will not cause a cable or system failure. Reducing airloads on the stabilizer reduces the effort needed to manually trim. Reducing airspeed reduces airloads on the stabilizer. Depending on the out of trim condition and force required to move the stabilizer trim wheel, flight crew coordination is important.
